name: SAPA
mission: SAPA works with communities, health providers and institutions (local and regional) to build the core functions of a health care system that is prepared to respond to crises.
theoryOfChange: SAPA (Sudanese American Physicians Association) has a published program strategy and programming framework. Their strategy is rooted in a comprehensive, holistic approach to healthcare delivery for vulnerable groups, with particular attention to the needs of women and children. This approach combines the provision of primary and tertiary care with health systems strengthening through health facility rehabilitation and capacity building of local health workers. SAPA's programming framework includes pillars such as Direct Health Service Delivery, Health System Resiliency, WASH (Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene), Food and Nutrition, and Protection. Their overarching humanitarian goals include ensuring access to essential healthcare services, implementing measures to prevent and control communicable diseases, providing food assistance, supporting health facilities, and strengthening the capacity of local healthcare workers and systems. They also implement a quality assurance framework that includes staff training, supervision, regular reporting, and partner-supported logistics. These strategic goals and frameworks are detailed in various reports and on their website.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 42/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; good program ratio (≥75%) suggests reasonable delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

judge_issues.message: The impact rationale mentions 'direct provision' but doesn't highlight the missing beneficiary data, which is a significant factor in the impact score (6/20 for Cost Per Beneficiary).

score_details.score_summary: Sudanese American Physicians Association earns 74/100 due to strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sapa-usa.org/zakat (Source: https://sapa-usa.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: SAPA holds a Charity Navigator score of 97.0/100 and works to build core functions of healthcare systems.
The organization provides specific donation options and giving methods for supporters.
SAPA is zakat-eligible and maintains a formal zakat policy for its programs.
In 2023, SAPA reported total revenue of $3,502,228 and operates programs for hunger relief and emergency services.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAPA earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial transparency, efficient use of donor funds, and critical mission addressing global health emergencies.
areas_for_improvement: Expanding impact measurement data to provide more specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics.
Increasing working capital reserves beyond the current 4.3 months to enhance long-term sustainability.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for donors interested in global health and humanitarian aid, particularly within a Muslim philanthropic context as a zakat-eligible entity [3]. Its focus on urgent crises in Sudan and Chad addresses high-priority global health needs while maintaining strong accountability standards [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: SAPA demonstrates direct impact through the provision of healthcare and emergency services, supported by a total revenue of $3,502,228 [4]. With a program expense ratio of 81.2%, the organization prioritizes direct aid over administrative costs, though more granular data on cost-per-beneficiary would further validate its effectiveness [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Sudanese American Physicians Association strengthens healthcare infrastructure and provides life-saving emergency relief to crisis-affected communities in Sudan and Chad.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 81.2% ensures the majority of funds directly support healthcare and relief services.
Excellent fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.11 to raise every $1.
Strong financial health with a Charity Navigator score of 97.0/100.
baseline_narrative.summary: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) works with local health providers and institutions to build resilient healthcare systems capable of responding to humanitarian crises [1]. The organization manages comprehensive programs including emergency services, hunger relief, and strategic healthcare interventions in Sudan and Chad [4]. SAPA is recognized as a zakat-eligible organization, maintaining a dedicated policy to ensure contributions reach those in need [3].

areas_for_improvement.context: While SAPA tracks outcomes, it currently lacks <cite id="17">specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics</cite> which would allow for more rigorous efficiency comparisons.
As an organization <cite id="10">founded in 2019</cite>, SAPA is still in a growth phase and is working to build a longer historical track record of large-scale project management.

bbb_assessment.summary: SAPA provides audited financial statements but has not yet been fully evaluated by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is actively tracking 13 outcome metrics on Candid to improve transparency.
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="17">absence of public cost-per-beneficiary data</cite>, making it difficult to assess comparative cost-effectiveness.

confidence.data_freshness: Data current through 2023 tax year and 2024 ratings
confidence.notes: Strong financial and transparency data available.

alignment.explanation: SAPA is a strong fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="3">verified zakat-eligible programs</cite> in high-urgency regions like Sudan.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust SAPA due to its <cite id="14">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and <cite id="1">perfect scores in leadership and culture</cite> from independent evaluators.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, SAPA could publish <cite id="18">independent third-party program evaluations</cite> to validate its internal outcome tracking.

impact.explanation: SAPA operates with a <cite id="4">81.2% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring maximum resource allocation to <cite id="13">direct healthcare provision</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="17">reporting total beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a clear cost-per-life-impacted analysis.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support specialized medical relief and healthcare system building in Sudan through a highly transparent, zakat-eligible organization.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates that while the organization tracks 13 outcome metrics, it has not yet published a rigorous external evaluation or RCT.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SAPA builds core healthcare functions and provides emergency services to ensure crisis-affected populations have access to essential medical care.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical interventions are effectively reducing mortality and improving health outcomes in crisis zones.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The ongoing humanitarian crisis in Sudan creates a massive funding gap for healthcare services that SAPA is positioned to fill.

strengths.detail: SAPA maintains an <cite id="1">overall score of 97.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, driven by a <cite id="1">perfect 100/100 score in Culture & Accountability</cite>.

The organization directs <cite id="4">81.2% of its expenses toward program services</cite> according to its most recent tax filings, significantly exceeding the <cite id="15">peer median of 84.6%</cite>.
SAPA demonstrates lean operations by spending only <cite id="1">$0.11 to raise every $1</cite> in total contributions.

strengths_deep_dive: SAPA's operational excellence is anchored in its ability to maintain <cite id="1">4.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing a robust financial cushion for emergency responses in volatile regions. Their governance is characterized by a <cite id="1">81.2% independent board of directors</cite>, ensuring objective oversight. Furthermore, the organization has demonstrated a commitment to impact transparency by <cite id="16">tracking 13 distinct outcome metrics</cite> through the Candid platform, which is rare for organizations of its size and maturity.
rich_narrative.summary: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) is a non-profit organization dedicated to <cite id="1">strengthening healthcare infrastructure and providing emergency relief</cite> in Sudan and Chad. Founded in <cite id="10">2019</cite>, the organization has rapidly scaled its operations to address the critical medical needs of populations affected by conflict and displacement. SAPA operates through a <cite id="11">direct service delivery model</cite>, working alongside local health providers to build resilient systems capable of responding to humanitarian crises. In 2023, the organization reported <cite id="4">$3,502,228 in total revenue</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="12">3-year revenue CAGR of 263.1%</cite>. This growth reflects the organization's increasing capacity to manage large-scale interventions, including <cite id="13">emergency medical missions, hunger relief, and water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) programs</cite>. SAPA is highly regarded for its transparency, holding a <cite id="14">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and an <cite id="1">overall score of 97.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. As a <cite id="3">zakat-eligible organization</cite>, SAPA provides a vital channel for Muslim donors to support healthcare in high-urgency, Muslim-majority regions, ensuring that <cite id="3">zakat funds are utilized for eligible asnaf</cite> such as the poor and needy.
